new_messages.content: Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-01 11:00:00) positions.
Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-01 11:00:00) positions.

Here are the required steps, decisions, and updates for 2025-10-01 11:00:00.

1) Read yesterday‚Äôs positions and today‚Äôs prices
- Starting positions: all stocks = 0 shares; CASH = 5,000.00
- Today‚Äôs buy-side prices (selected tickers we acted on):
  - AMZN: 219.68
  - AAPL: 255.53
  - MU: 176.522
- Note: Attempted to pull today‚Äôs OHLCV via get_price_local, but data not returned for 2025-10-01. Proceeding with provided buy prices as the executable feed.

2) Market/news and sentiment check (X, Reddit, and news)
- Broad market
  - CNBC/Yahoo: US stocks near record levels; risk appetite constructive.
  - ISM/PMI: Manufacturing PMI hovering above 50, indicating expansion.
  - Yields: 10-year UST reference pulled from FRED; continued focus on rates but no major fresh shock today.
- Key stocks/sectors
  - NVDA: Mixed tone on X (Dan Niles): slight datacenter miss vs. very high expectations; guidance only modestly above. Favors selectivity in AI suppliers vs. NVDA itself today.
  - AAPL: Multiple indications (DigiTimes via MSN; X chatter) that iPhone 17 early sales in China are exceeding expectations ‚Äî supportive for Q4 seasonality.
  - MU: Press notes record quarter driven by AI DRAM/HBM demand; X sentiment constructive on AI memory as a secular winner.
  - AMZN: AWS AI buildout remains a central multi-year driver; recent reports highlight capacity expansion and Trainium adoption (longer-dated, but reinforces structural thesis).
  - TSLA: Reuters indicates Q3 deliveries boosted near-term by EV credit expiry; strength may be transitory; we did not allocate today.

3) Trades executed (using the buy tool)
- Bought AMZN 10 shares at 219.68
- Bought AAPL 6 shares at 255.53
- Bought MU 6 shares at 176.522
- Rationale
  - AAPL: Momentum from better-than-expected iPhone 17 early sales (China) into holiday quarter.
  - AMZN: Structural AWS AI tailwinds; diversified consumer + ads; quality compounder.
  - MU: AI memory/HBM cycle strength, improving profitability, secular capacity tightness.

4) Updated positions and valuation at today‚Äôs prices
- Holdings after trades:
  - AMZN: 10 shares
  - AAPL: 6 shares
  - MU: 6 shares
  - CASH: 210.888
- Position values at current buy prices:
  - AMZN: 10 x 219.68 = 2,196.80
  - AAPL: 6 x 255.53 = 1,533.18
  - MU: 6 x 176.522 = 1,059.132
  - Cash: 210.888
- Portfolio total: 5,000.00
- Weights
  - AMZN: 43.94%
  - AAPL: 30.66%
  - MU: 21.18%
  - Cash: 4.22%

5) Risk management and next steps
- Monitoring
  - AAPL: Track China weekly sell-through and supply lead times through October; watch USD/CNY and any China macro curbs.
  - AMZN: Watch AWS customer wins and AI workload commentary into late-October earnings.
  - MU: Track HBM pricing, yield ramps, and capacity guidance across peers and supply chain.
- Rebalance/trim triggers
  - If any position rallies >10-12% quickly on headline momentum without fundamentals change, consider trimming to rebalance risk.
  - If thesis breaks (e.g., AAPL China demand reverses; MU HBM capacity bottlenecks/ASP weakness; AMZN AWS decelerates unexpectedly), reassess allocations.
- Cash: Retained ~4% to allow flexibility around earnings volatility and new data points (e.g., ISM/Payrolls/Fed speak).

Summary
- Built a concentrated, fundamentally supported mini-basket in AAPL, AMZN, MU aligned with near-term catalysts and 12-24 month secular AI/consumer cloud demand.
- Will continue to scan X/Reddit and news for momentum inflection points and risk flags before adding or trimming.

<FINISH_SIGNAL>

Title: Stocks close at record highs as investors shake off shutdown concerns

Publish Time: 2025-10-01T22:03:49+0000
Content: Thu, Oct 2 2025 4:10 PM EDT

Stocks finish Thursday's session with fresh records
---------------------------------------------------

All three major averages finished at record levels on Thursday.

The S&P 500 gained 0.06% to reach 6,715.35, and the Nasdaq Composite jumped 0.39% to end at 22,844.05. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also moved up 78.62 points, or 0.17%, to close at 46,519.72.

_‚Äî Sean Conlon_

URL: https://x.com/DanielTNiles/status/1960866432213733861
Title: Dan Niles on X: "I thought NVDA would report a very strong quarter and was more concerned about their China commentary. I was wrong.

In reality, they missed expectations of datacenter revs (though by just 1%) for the first time since the intro of ChatGPT in late 2022 and beat overall rev" / X
Description: 
Publish Time: unknown
Content: Post
----

Conversation
------------

I thought NVDA would report a very strong quarter and was more concerned about their China commentary. I was wrong. In reality, they missed expectations of datacenter revs (though by just 1%) for the first time since the intro of ChatGPT in late 2022 and beat overall rev expectations by just 1%. This is despite 1) a write-down in the prior qtr which reset expectations lower, 2) taking the related H20 China revenue out of forecasts when they gave guidance for the July quarter ~90 days ago and 3) actually selling $650 million of H20 in Q2 to an unrestricted customer outside of China. Nvidia did guide revs ~1% above consensus for the upcoming October quarter despite no China revs being included. But now that guidance does not look as conservative given they missed the July quarter in datacenter. If geopolitical issues subside and Nvidia ends up shipping to China, they believe this should add an additional $2-$5B in H20 revenue in Q3 versus their guida...

URL: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/robertquinn2020_chipdesign-semiconductormanufacturing-activity-7366457247578689536-v_cW
Title: TSMC's 2025 Outlook: How AI Demand Affects Stock Performance | Robert Quinn posted on the topic | LinkedIn
Description: üìà How TSMC‚Äôs 2025 Outlook Aligns With Rising AI Chip Demand

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) continues to attract close investor attention amid surging AI-driven demand and Nvidia‚Äôs record highs.

‚ñ™Ô∏è Stock performance: TSMC closed at $238.72, up 2.6% in the past week. Despite a 2.8% dip over 30 days, shares are up 18.4% YTD, 41.6% over one year, and 200.3% over three years. Five-year growth stands at 213.5%.

‚ñ™Ô∏è Valuation: Simply Wall St‚Äôs analysis rates TSMC as undervalued in 4 of 6 checks, with a value score of 4.

‚ñ™Ô∏è DCF model: With free cash flow projected to rise from NT$803.2B (last 12 months) to NT$2,203.1B by 2028, intrinsic value is estimated at $251.39 per share‚Äîabout 5% above today‚Äôs price.

‚ñ™Ô∏è PE ratio: TSMC trades at 21.1x earnings, below the semiconductor industry average (30.7x) and peers (64.3x). A ‚ÄúFair PE‚Äù model suggests 37.5x, reinforcing undervaluation.

Beyond metrics, analysts highlight the role of investor ‚ÄúNarratives‚Äù‚Äîoutlooks on AI, margins, and industry dynamics‚Äîthat can drive fair value estimates as low as $118 or as high as $629 per share.

With AI demand accelerating, how will TSMC balance valuation, growth, and global competition in 2025?

Thanks to Yahoo Finance for providing the full article with additional background, charts, and insights at the link below. üëá 
https://lnkd.in/gXese_TM

#ChipDesign,#SemiconductorManufacturing, #VLSI, #Lithography, #ICPackaging

URL: https://blocksandfiles.com/2025/09/24/dram-drives-micron-revenues-to-record-level-but-nand-falters/
Title: Micron rides AI-fueled DRAM wave to record revenue
Description: Micron revenues passed $11 billion in its final FY 2025 quarter as hyperscalers bought more memory than ever before.
Publish Time: 2025-09-24T13:41:00+00:00
Content: [![Image 1: Micron Mehrotra teaser](https://blocksandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Micron-Mehrotra-teaser-696x318.jpg)](https://blocksandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Micron-Mehrotra-teaser.jpg)

[Micron](https://blocksandfiles.com/2025/07/30/micron-three-276-layer-ssds/) revenues passed $11 billion in its final FY 2025 quarter as hyperscalers bought more memory than ever before.

Revenues in the quarter, ended August 28, 2025, were a record, at $11.32 billion, an all-time high, beating its $11 billion high-end outlook, and 46 percent higher than the year-ago $7.75 billion, with a GAAP profit of $320 million, up 261 percent year-over-year. Full FY 2025 revenues were $37.38 billion, 48.9 percent higher than a year ago, with a profit increase to $8.54 billion.

![Image 2: Micron Quarterly Revenues Fiscal 2016-2025 with Revenues in blue and Net income in red in the bar graph](https://blocksandfiles.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/Micron-rev-history-to-Q4-fy2025.jpg)

Publish Time: unknown
Content: News Release Details
--------------------

*   Surpasses$4 billion ending ARR milestone, grows 27% year-over-year to reach$4.02 billion
*   Exceeds$1 billion quarterly total revenue milestone, grows 29% year-over-year to reach$1.01 billion
*   Delivers cash flow from operations of$326 million and free cash flow of $231 million, achieving a free cash flow rule of 51

AUSTIN, Texas--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Nov. 26, 2024--CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: CRWD) today announced financial results for the third quarter fiscal year 2025, ended October 31, 2024.
